revised_title: Antibiotic Resistance Patterns in Enteric Bacteria of Wild Mammals on Krakatau Islands
tldr: This study examines the antibiotic resistance patterns of enteric bacteria in wild mammals on the Krakatau Islands and West Java, Indonesia. The researchers found significant differences in the faecal flora of rats and bats on the islands, with mammals on Java showing higher levels of antibiotic resistance. The study suggests that the widespread use of antibiotics by humans on Java may be contributing to the increased resistance in the local wildlife.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
